examples: they work every day except Sunday
I was naked except for my socks

conjunction.description: Used before a statement that forms an exception to one just made.
examples: I didn't tell him anything, except that I needed the money
our berets were the same except mine had a leather band inside

verb.description: Specify as not included in a category or group; exclude.
examples: he excepted from his criticism a handful of distinguished writers

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin except- taken out, from the verb excipere, from ex- out of + capere take.
